qas.question: How do fireworks create green sparks?
Which copper salt can produce green glames?
What is the ratio of boron to potassium nitrate in green pyrotechnic flares?
What is the ratio of yellow to green in green smoke?
What is another name for copper salts?

plausible_answers.text: barium chlorate, barium nitrate crystals, or barium chloride

qas.question: What type of copper salts are used in fireworks?
What else are copper salts used for?
Which two solvents are used in green pyrotechnic flares?

context: To create green sparks, fireworks use <a0_0><b4_0>barium salts<b4_0/><a0_0/>, such as <b5_0>barium chlorate, barium nitrate crystals, or barium chloride<b5_0/>, also used for green <b6_0>fireplace logs<b6_0/>. Copper salts typically burn blue, but <a1_0>cupric chloride<a1_0/> (also known as "campfire blue") can also produce green flames. Green pyrotechnic flares can use a mix ratio <a2_0><b3_0>75:25<b3_0/><a2_0/> of boron and potassium nitrate. Smoke can be turned green by a mixture: <b7_0>solvent yellow 33, solvent green 3<b7_0/>, lactose, magnesium carbonate plus sodium carbonate added to potassium chlorate.
